findings.title: Possible griefing attack to cancel motions
findings.description: A Node Operator can spam motions, and there are two options for responding to the situation: deactivate NO through Aragon voting or remove all the IncreaseNodeOperatorStakingLimit Factory from EVMScriptFactoriesRegistry and then increase NO’s staking limits through Aragon votings.

findings.title: Inconsistent naming of function parameters
findings.description: Function parameters do not follow a consistent naming convention.

findings.title: Variables can be immutable
findings.description: Multiple variables have similar names, which could lead to confusion and potential errors.

findings.title: No checks for address zero
findings.description: The recipientAddress, rewardProgramAddress, and _evmScriptFactory variables are not checked for address(0) at multiple locations.

findings.title: Incorrect NatSpec comments
findings.description: The encoded tuple should be `(address recipientAddress, string title)` at AddAllowedRecipient.sol#L43 and `(address _rewardProgram, string _title)` at AddRewardProgram.sol#L42.

findings.title: Possible to create a motion with transfer amount bigger than single transfer limit
findings.description: It's possible to create a motion with a transfer amount exceeding the single transfer limit.

findings.title: Event parameter can be indexed
findings.description: The event parameter can be indexed to improve the contract's functionality and performance.

findings.title: Gas optimization by replacing memory with calldata
findings.description: Optimizing gas usage by replacing memory with calldata can improve contract efficiency.
